intro: Prinos dioicus, commonly known as the two-leaved prion. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae, characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically arranged in pairs along the stems. It produces bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Prinos dioicus is native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained, acidic soils.
